meanings.definition: The point where a cable television signal is received and distributed.
meanings.sent1: The headends of the cable system ensure that the signal reaches all the TVs.
meanings.sent2: The technician checked the headends to make sure the signal was strong.
meanings.sent3: The headends were feeling overwhelmed with all the channels they had to manage.
meanings.sent4: The headends acted like traffic controllers, directing the signal flow.
meanings.sent5: The headends were like the heart of the cable network, pumping out entertainment to every home.

meanings.definition: The beginning or end of a process or system.
meanings.sent1: At the headends of the project, the team discussed their goals.
meanings.sent2: The headends of the assembly line were where the products were finalized.
meanings.sent3: The headends of the day were always busy with planning and reflection.
meanings.sent4: The headends of the journey marked the start of new adventures.
meanings.sent5: The headends were like the bookends of the operation, holding everything together.

meanings.definition: The top or front part of something.
meanings.sent1: The headends of the ship offered a great view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The headends of the classroom were where the eager students sat.
meanings.sent3: The headends of the line were reserved for VIP guests.
meanings.sent4: The headends of the building were adorned with intricate designs.
meanings.sent5: The headends were like the crowns of the structures, standing tall and proud.
